duties_responsibilities.duty: Design, build, and maintain bidirectional integrations between Workday and other platforms with a focus on data quality and data security.
Stay updated on Workday features and tools to enhance integration capabilities.
Manage data transformation, validation, and error resolution for accurate and consistent data transfers.
Monitor integration performance and identify opportunities for optimization and enhancement.
Adhere to data security and compliance standards for integration solutions.
Develop new reports and integrations for internal and external systems.
Partner with stakeholders to create system configuration documents, functional specifications, and testing strategies.

education_certification.credential:
7+ years of HRIS experience with 5 years as a Workday Integration SME.
Workday Integrations, Studio & PRISM (highly desirable) experience
Technical experience with building integrations between HR, Benefits, Payroll (ADP), and Financials Management systems (SAP).
Prior experience with SOAP, REST web services, middleware technologies (Boomi, Mulesoft etc), and Oxygen XML developer.
Excellent communication skills, oral, written, and interpersonal skills.
Workday certification in Integrations, Studio, and PRISM.
Knowledge of Identity Access Management (IAM) and experience creating custom integration with the IAM.
Prior BIRT report development experience.
Experience with creating and managing data flow diagrams and Integration architecture diagrams in lucid chart/Visio.
